explanation:
code_hardening: The Swing UI is created on the Event Dispatch Thread using javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeLater, and the frame is configured with a default close operation, size, and visibility set after all components are added.
resolve_compilation_errors: The function uses fully qualified class names (e.g., javax.swing.JFrame, javax.swing.JButton, com.opendoorlogistics.codefromweb.DraggableTabbedPane) so it compiles without relying on imports. All mouse and dragging logic is avoided by only instantiating the existing DraggableTabbedPane.
exception_handling: Look and Feel setup is wrapped in a try-catch that catches generic Exception and silently ignores failures, as required.
logic_customization: The logic converts the class role to a runnable demo entry point by providing a main method that sets Nimbus Look and Feel if available, creates a JFrame titled "Tab test", instantiates a DraggableTabbedPane, adds four tabs each containing a JButton, and shows the window.
refactoring: No internal behavior or state is used; the function is focused solely on demo setup, effectively refactoring usage away from drag-implementation concerns.
misc: Minimal inline comments are included for clarity, formatting is consistent, and no additional helper methods or APIs beyond standard Swing (javax.swing.SwingUtilities, javax.swing.UIManager) are introduced.
